section.name: s1
section.heading: Citation

subsection.content: These regulations may be cited as the Gas Safety (Gas Supply) Regulations.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In these regulations, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: approved plans (批准圖則), in relation to construction work which has construction approval, means the plans, including any modifications thereto, specified in a notice under regulation 5(1)(a) or (b) as the plans in accordance with which the construction work shall be carried out;
cargo compartment (載貨間), in relation to a cylinder wagon, means that part of the wagon which is used to carry cylinders;
construction approval (建造批准) means the approval under regulation 5(1)(a) or (b) of construction work;

construction work (建造工程) means work in connection with the erection, relocation or major alteration of a notifiable gas installation, or major repairs of a structural nature to a notifiable gas installation;

direct-fired vaporiser (明火直熱式汽化器) means a vaporiser which burns liquefied petroleum gas or other fuel to provide heat directly to that part of the vaporiser through which liquefied petroleum gas flows;

fixed maximum level device (固定式最高液位計) means a device fitted to a tank for the purpose of ascertaining whether the amount of liquefied petroleum gas in the tank is more than the safe filling capacity of the tank;
flexible gas tubing (氣體接駁軟喉) means flexible gas tubing within the meaning of the Gas Safety (Miscellaneous) Regulations (Cap. 51 sub. leg. F); (E.R. 5 of 2022)
high pressure (高壓) means a pressure of more than 700 kPa;
intermediate pressure (次高壓) means a pressure of more than 240 kPa but not more than 700 kPa;
liquefied petroleum gas storage installation (石油氣儲存裝置) means a gas installation as described in paragraph (f) of the definition of notifiable gas installation; (E.R. 5 of 2022)
low pressure (低壓) means a pressure of not more than 7.5 kPa;
medium pressure (中壓) means a pressure of more than 7.5 kPa but not more than 240 kPa;
prescribed fee (訂明費用), in relation to any provision of these regulations, means the fee prescribed in Schedule 1 in relation to that provision;
vaporiser (汽化器) means any equipment used, or to be used, to provide heat for the vaporisation of liquefied petroleum gas.

subsection.leadIn: In these regulations, unless the contrary intention appears, a reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the erection of a notifiable gas installation includes, where the case requires, a reference to the removal of the installation and its re-erection, with or without alteration, after its removal from another location;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the alteration of a notifiable gas installation includes a reference to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the demolition of part of the installation; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an addition to the installation; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: carrying out construction work in accordance with approved plans includes a reference to the carrying out of construction work in accordance with plans, or those plans as amended, whether before or after the commencement of the construction work, as approved in accordance with these regulations.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Construction and Use of Notifiable Gas Installations

section.name: s3
section.heading: No person to construct, etc. notifiable gas installation unless construction approval, etc. has been obtained

subsection.leadIn: No person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: carry out any construction work unless such work has construction approval; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: use any notifiable gas installation to which any construction approval relates unless the use of such installation is approved under regulation 6.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall supply gas to a notifiable gas installation where he knows, or ought reasonably to know, that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: construction work has been carried out on it; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is being used,

subsection.continued: in contravention of subregulation (1).

subsection.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that the erection of a notifiable gas installation which is a store includes placing any container or containers in the place which is or is to be the store, and whether or not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the container or containers, as the case may be, are—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: placed in any premises or part of any premises;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: owned by one or more persons;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other construction work has been carried out in relation to the store. (L.N. 462 of 1995)

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that the definition of container in section 2 of the Ordinance shall apply for the purposes of subregulation (3). (L.N. 462 of 1995)

section.name: s4
section.heading: Application for construction approval

subsection.content: The person who proposes to carry out construction work may make an application to the Authority for construction approval of the construction work, including modifications of construction work for which construction approval has already been given.

subsection.leadIn: An application under subregulation (1) shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the approved form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: accompanied by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a written statement as to the purpose of the notifiable gas installation to which the application relates;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the prescribed fee;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.leadIn: 2 copies of all plans relating to the installation, including—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a plan showing the siting of the installation; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a plan showing details of the environment surrounding the installation; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a written statement setting out particulars of all buildings, containers, machinery, plant and equipment to form part of, or to be used in connection with, the installation.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, by notice in writing served on a person who has made an application under subregulation (1), require the person to furnish him with—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: such particulars as are specified in the notice,

subsection.continued: being plans and particulars which the Authority thinks necessary for determining the application under regulation 5.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Determination of application for construction approval

subsection.leadIn: Subject to this regulation, the Authority shall determine an application made under regulation 4(1) by a person for construction approval by serving in accordance with subregulation (2) a notice on the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: granting construction approval of the construction work in accordance with such plans as were submitted under regulation 4(2)(b)(iii) with that application, and such other plans as were submitted in accordance with any notice under regulation 4(3) served on that person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: granting construction approval of the construction work in accordance with such plans as were submitted under regulation 4(2)(b)(iii) with that application, and such other plans as were submitted in accordance with any notice under regulation 4(3) served on that person, subject to such reasonable conditions by way of modifications to any of those plans as are set out in the notice served under this regulation on that person; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: refusing to grant construction approval of the construction work.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subregulation (1) in respect of an application made under regulation 4(1) shall be served—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where no notice has been given under regulation 4(3) in respect of that application within a period of 60 days after that application was so made, not later than the expiration of that period; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where a notice has been given under regulation 4(3) in respect of that application within a period of 60 days after that application was so made, not later than 30 days after the Authority has been furnished with the plans or particulars required by the notice under regulation 4(3).

subsection.leadIn: The Authority shall not grant construction approval of construction work unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the notifiable gas installation will, if constructed in accordance with the approved plans, comply with the requirements under the Ordinance applicable to such an installation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority is satisfied that the notifiable gas installation will not present an unacceptable risk to the health and safety of members of the public residing or working in the vicinity of the place where the installation will be constructed, whether during its construction or after it is brought into use.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of conditions which may be imposed under subregulation (1)(b) by way of modification to any plans submitted under regulation 4(2)(b)(iii) or submitted in accordance with a notice served under regulation 4(3), construction approval of construction work may be granted subject to such reasonable conditions, whether by way of modification to such plans or otherwise—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: as the Authority thinks fit, in particular—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: specifying the construction and location of buildings or other structures on the site which is served or to be served by the notifiable gas installation for the purpose of ensuring that ventilation of the installation will not be impaired; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: restricting the planting of vegetation in the vicinity of the notifiable gas installation for the purpose of ensuring that ventilation of the installation will not be impaired or that a potential fire hazard for the installation is not created; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as are specified in the notice under subregulation (1) of such construction approval.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Authority grants construction approval of construction work, he shall endorse every page of the approved plans in respect of the notifiable gas installation and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: retain one set of copies of such plans; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: forward one set of copies of such plans with the notice under subregulation (1) of such construction approval.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: grants construction approval of construction work subject to conditions; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuses to grant construction approval of construction work,

subsection.continued: he shall specify in the notice under subregulation (1) of such grant or refusal of construction approval, as the case may be, his reasons for the imposition of the conditions or the refusal, as the case may be.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Approval of use of notifiable gas installation

subsection.leadIn: Where a person who has been granted construction approval of construction work is of the opinion that the construction work has been completed in accordance with that construction approval, he may, by notice served on the Authority and accompanied by the prescribed fee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state that he is of that opinion; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: request the Authority to approve the use of the notifiable gas installation concerned.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Authority is served a notice under subregulation (1) by a person he shall, not later than 14 working days after such service—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inspect the notifiable gas installation concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if, after such inspection—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: he is of the same opinion as that stated in that notice, by notice served on that person approve the use of that installation subject to such conditions, if any, as he thinks fit; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: he is not of that opinion, by notice served on that person refuse to approve the use of that installation.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: approves the use of a notifiable gas installation subject to conditions; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refuses to approve the use of a notifiable gas installation,

subsection.continued: he shall specify in the notice under subregulation (2) of such approval, or refusal to approve, the use of the notifiable gas installation, his reasons for the imposition of the conditions or the refusal, as the case may be.

part.name: P2A
part.heading: Safety and Inspection of Notifiable Gas Installations

section.name: s6A
section.heading: Application
section.content: This Part applies to a notifiable gas installation whether or not it was constructed before, on or after the commencement* of this Part.

section.name: s6B
section.heading: General duty of owner of notifiable gas installation to maintain, etc. installation in safe condition
section.content: Without prejudice to the operation of any other provisions of these regulations in relation to a notifiable gas installation (howsoever described), the owner of the installation shall maintain and operate the installation in a safe condition for the prevention of fire, explosion or other danger arising from the installation.

section.name: s6C
section.heading: Inspections to be carried out by owner of notifiable gas installation

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, by notice in the Gazette, specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the inspections which the owner of a notifiable gas installation specified in the notice, or belonging to a class of notifiable gas installations specified in the notice, shall carry out on the installation to ascertain whether the installation is maintained and operated in accordance with regulation 6B;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the intervals at which, or the circumstances in which, such inspections shall be carried out;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the written records which shall be kept of such inspections by such owners and the periods for which any such records shall be retained by such owners;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the copies of any such records to be submitted to the Authority by such owners and the periods within which any such records are to be so submitted after they have been made.

subsection.leadIn: The owner of a notifiable gas installation shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: comply with the requirements of any notice under subregulation (1) applicable to him;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if required to carry out any inspection specified in the notice, ensure that the inspection is carried out by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a person who is competent, by virtue of his training and substantial practical experience, to carry out that inspection; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a person who is under the supervision of a person referred to in subparagraph (i).

section.name: s7
section.heading: Only approved containers may be used to contain liquefied petroleum gas

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subregulation (2), the owner of a container shall not use the container to contain liquefied petroleum gas unless the container— (22 of 1996 s. 7)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been approved in writing, or is of a type which has been approved in writing, by the Authority for such use; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is of a type which has been approved under regulation 64 of the Dangerous Goods (General) Regulations (Cap. 295 sub. leg. B) for such use and such approval was in force immediately before the commencement* of the Ordinance. (E.R. 5 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: Where the Authority is satisfied that a container to which subregulation (1)(a) or (b) applies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has shown to be prejudicial to the safety of the members of the public; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has, for any other reason (including its supersession by another type of container), ceased to be of a standard of safety acceptable to the Authority,

subsection.continued: then the Authority may, by notice in the Gazette, specify a date on and after which the owner of the container shall cease to use the container to contain liquefied petroleum gas. (22 of 1996 s. 7)

subsection.content: No person shall, without reasonable excuse, use a container the subject of a notice under subregulation (2) to contain liquefied petroleum gas on or after the date specified in the notice as the date on which such use of the container shall cease. (22 of 1996 s. 7)

section.name: s8
section.heading: Examinations and inspections to be carried out on cylinders and tanks

subsection.leadIn: No person shall fill any cylinder with liquefied petroleum gas unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the cylinder has, immediately prior to such filling, been externally examined for defects, including dents, gouges and corrosion; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person who has carried out such examination is of the opinion that it is safe for that cylinder to be so filled.

subsection.content: The owner of a cylinder (other than a disposable cylinder) shall not use the cylinder to contain liquefied petroleum gas unless the cylinder has been tested and examined not less than once in the 5 years period immediately preceding such use to ascertain whether the cylinder is safe to be so used.

subsection.leadIn: The owner of a tank which is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: above ground level; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not covered by sand or earth,

subsection.continued: shall not use the tank to contain liquefied petroleum gas unless the tank has been tested and examined not less than once in the 10 years period immediately preceding such use to ascertain whether the tank is safe to be so used.

subsection.leadIn: The owner of a tank which is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: below ground level; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: above ground level and covered with sand or earth,

subsection.continued: shall not use the tank to contain liquefied petroleum gas unless the tank has been tested and examined not less than once— (L.N. 259 of 1997)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: in the 10 years period immediately following the first time the tank is so used; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: after the expiration of the period referred to in paragraph (i), in the 5 years period immediately preceding such use,

subsection.continued: to ascertain whether the tank is safe to be so used.

subsection.content: The owner of a tank shall keep a written record of the results of any test and examination carried out on the tank pursuant to subregulation (3) or (4) until the tank ceases to be used to contain liquefied petroleum gas.

Where any test and examination carried out on a tank pursuant to subregulation (3) or (4) shows that the tank is not safe to be used to contain liquefied petroleum gas, the owner of that tank shall not so use the tank unless work has been subsequently carried out on the tank which renders the tank safe to be so used.

subsection.leadIn: Any test and examination carried out before the commencement* of the Ordinance on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a cylinder, in accordance with regulation 66 of the Dangerous Goods (General) Regulations (Cap. 295 sub. leg. B), shall be deemed to be a test and examination carried out on that cylinder in accordance with subregulation (2); and (E.R. 5 of 2022)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a tank, in accordance with the terms and conditions endorsed on a licence to store liquefied petroleum gas in that tank granted under the Dangerous Goods Ordinance (Cap. 295), shall be deemed to be a test and examination carried out on that tank in accordance with subregulation (3) or (4), as the case may be.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Pressure relief valves fitted to cylinders
section.leadIn: The owner of a cylinder which has a water capacity of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: not less than 40 litres, shall not use the cylinder to contain liquefied petroleum gas unless the cylinder is fitted with a pressure relief valve—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: of the spring-loaded, or equivalent, type; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in contact with the vapour space of the cylinder when it is positioned for normal use;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: less than 40 litres, shall not, subject to paragraph (c), use the cylinder to contain liquefied petroleum gas if the cylinder is fitted with a pressure relief valve unless the cylinder has—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: been used to contain such gas before the commencement* of the Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: not been re-valved on or after that commencement; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: less than 40 litres, shall not use the cylinder to provide—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: liquefied petroleum gas to a dim sum trolley; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: such gas in liquid form,

paragraph.continued: unless the cylinder is fitted with a pressure relief valve.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Filling capacity of tanks and cylinders

subsection.leadIn: The owner of a tank shall not set a fixed maximum level device fitted to the tank other than at a setting such that, at a temperature of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 47.5 degrees centigrade, the tank will not be more than 97% full of liquefied petroleum gas in liquid form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 52.5 degrees centigrade, the tank will not be full of liquefied petroleum gas in liquid form.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall fill a tank or cylinder with liquefied petroleum gas other than such that, at a temperature of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 47.5 degrees centigrade, the tank will not be more than 97%, and the cylinder will not be more than 95%, full of liquefied petroleum gas in liquid form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 52.5 degrees centigrade, the tank or cylinder will not be full of liquefied petroleum gas in liquid form.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Requirements for liquefied petroleum gas storage installations
section.leadIn: The owner of a liquefied petroleum gas storage installation shall ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the installation is well-ventilated;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the installation is accessible for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the replacement and maintenance of the tanks or cylinders which comprise the installation; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: fire-fighting purposes in the event of a fire in or near the installation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: any safety feature provided for the installation, being a radiation wall, fixed water drenching system or diversion kerb, together with the distances between the tanks or cylinders which comprise the installation and any—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: property boundary;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: fixed source of ignition; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: building other than the building in which the installation is situated,

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the risk of any liquefied petroleum gas escaping from the installation being ignited before being dispersed or diluted is, so far as is practicable, minimized; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the installation is protected against the radiation effects of any fire occurring outside the installation;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: ventilation and explosion relief measures other than explosion relief panels are provided for the installation; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: where the installation is part of a piped gas supply system and more than one tank or cylinder which comprises the installation is at any one time providing liquefied petroleum gas to such system by means of flexible gas tubing connected to a common manifold, the installation has incorporated in it safety devices which will ensure that if such tubing between one such tank or cylinder and the common manifold fails, such failure does not cause the complete loss of such gas from any other tank or cylinder which is connected by such tubing to such manifold.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Requirements for tanks

subsection.leadIn: The owner of a tank which is placed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: below ground level; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: above ground level and covered with sand or earth,

subsection.continued: shall not use the tank to contain liquefied petroleum gas unless the tank—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.leadIn: is covered with a coating material—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: bonded to all external surfaces of the tank; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: which will protect the tank against corrosion; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: is fitted with a cathodic protection system together with a test point for such system.

subsection.content: The owner of a tank which is fitted with a cathodic protection system as required by subregulation (1)(ii) shall cause such system to be tested not less than once in each 6 months period and the results of such test to be recorded in writing and retained until the tank ceases to be used to contain liquefied petroleum gas. (L.N. 350 of 1990)

section.name: s13
section.heading: Provision of shut-off valves for vaporisers
section.content: No person shall use any vaporiser to vaporise liquefied petroleum gas unless shut-off valves have been fitted to each liquid or vapour line between the vaporiser and the container for which it is provided.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Testing and examination of vaporisers

subsection.leadIn: The owner of a vaporiser shall not use the vaporiser to vaporise liquefied petroleum gas unless the vaporiser has been tested and examined not less than once—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a direct-fired vaporiser, within the 12 months period immediately preceding such use; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of any other vaporiser, within the 5 years period immediately preceding such use,

subsection.continued: to ascertain whether the vaporiser is safe to be so used.

subsection.content: The owner of a vaporiser shall keep a written record of the results of any test and examination carried out on the vaporiser pursuant to subregulation (1) until the vaporiser ceases to be used to vaporise liquefied petroleum gas.

Where any test and examination carried out on a vaporiser pursuant to subregulation (1) shows that the vaporiser is not safe to be used to vaporise liquefied petroleum gas, the owner of that vaporiser shall not so use the vaporiser unless work has been subsequently carried out on the vaporiser which renders the vaporiser safe to be so used.

Any test and examination carried out before the commencement* of the Ordinance on a vaporiser provided for a gas installation, in accordance with the terms and conditions endorsed on a licence to store liquefied petroleum gas in that gas installation granted under the Dangerous Goods Ordinance (Cap. 295), shall be deemed to be a test and examination carried out on that vaporiser in accordance with subregulation (1).

part.name: P5
part.heading: Requirements for Gas Pipes and Pressure-Regulating Installations

section.name: s15
section.heading: Application
section.content: For the purposes of this Part, gas pipe (氣體喉管) shall not include an installation pipe.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Only competent persons to carry out work on or in relation to gas pipes
section.leadIn: No person shall carry out any work on or in relation to a gas pipe unless he is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: competent, by virtue of his training and substantial practical experience, to carry out that work; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under the supervision of a person to whom paragraph (a) applies.

section.name: s17
section.heading: General safety requirements for gas pipes

subsection.leadIn: No person shall install a gas pipe unless the pipe is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: constructed of sound materials; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to the type, and operating pressure, of the gas to be conveyed therein, of such size and strength as to safely convey such gas at such pressure.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall install a gas pipe other than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in a sound and workmanlike manner; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: so that any joint therein is gastight.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall install a gas pipe unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its external surfaces are constructed of material which is inherently resistant to corrosion or are protected against corrosion; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where there is a risk of corrosion to its internal surfaces, such surfaces are, so far as is reasonably practicable, protected against corrosion.

subsection.content: No person shall install a gas main for the conveyance of liquefied petroleum gas along or across a road.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall install a gas pipe in any location where it may be subject to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: abnormal mechanical loading; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: rapid deterioration,

subsection.continued: unless it is protected from any adverse effects of such loading or deterioration.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall install a service pipe—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of internal diameter of 50 millimetres or more in any premises;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any premises where the nature of the premises or any activity carried on therein is such that there is a special risk of personal injury, fire, explosion or other danger arising from the supply of gas to such premises; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in any premises where such pipe supplies gas to more than one primary meter,

subsection.continued: unless he also fixes a valve in the pipe in a readily accessible position outside of, but as near as practicable to, the boundaries of the premises concerned and in such a manner that, so far as is reasonably practicable, there is not a risk of wilful or accidental misuse of the valve.

subsection.content: No person shall install a gas pipe above the ground unless it is protected to ensure, so far as is reasonably practicable, that there is not a risk of accidental damage to the pipe.

No person shall install a gas pipe in a service duct in any premises unless any other services contained in the duct are compatible with that pipe in a that safety of the occupants of the premises is not thereby prejudiced.

Subject to subregulation (10), no person shall install a service pipe in a service duct in any premises unless such duct is ventilated such that any escape of gas from any part of such pipe enclosed by such duct is able to disperse in such a manner that safety of the occupants of the premises is not thereby prejudiced.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall install a service riser in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: domestic premises; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: non-domestic premises (other than non-domestic premises in which an industrial undertaking within the meaning of the Factories and Industrial Undertakings Ordinance (Cap. 59) is being carried out) in respect of which the Building Authority, within the meaning of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123), has given his approval (including a deemed approval) under that Ordinance for the building works thereof on or after 1 January 1991,

subsection.continued: unless—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the service riser is installed in a service duct; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: such duct is ventilated such that any escape of gas from any part of such riser enclosed by such duct disperses to air outside the premises concerned.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Enclosed gas pipes

subsection.content: No person shall install any part of a gas pipe through a floor or standing of solid construction unless the pipe is enclosed in a sleeve which does not prevent the normal movement of the pipe.

No person shall install any part of a gas pipe through a wall of solid construction unless, so far as is reasonably practicable, the pipe is so constructed and installed as to be protected against failure caused by movement.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall install any part of a gas pipe in the cavity of a cavity wall unless the pipe—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is to pass through the wall from one side to the other by the shortest practicable route; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: is enclosed in a gastight sleeve which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: prevents, so far as is reasonably practicable, gas passing along any space between—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the pipe and the sleeve; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the sleeve and the cavity wall; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: does not prevent the normal movement of the pipe.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Protection of premises
section.content: No person shall install a gas pipe in a way which would impair the structure of any premises or impair the fire resistance of any part of its structure.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Pressure tests on gas pipes, etc.

subsection.content: A person who installs a gas pipe shall, forthwith after such installation and before the pipe is commissioned, carry out a pressure test on such pipe to ensure that it is structurally sound and gastight.

subsection.leadIn: A person who carries out a pressure test required under subregulation (1) on a gas pipe shall ensure that precautions have been taken to protect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the persons carrying out such test;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any persons working in the vicinity of the place where such test is being carried out; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: members of the public,

subsection.continued: against any dangers which may arise if such pipe should fail the test.

subsection.content: Upon the completion of any pressure test required under subregulation (1), the person who carried out that test shall, as soon as is reasonably practicable, reduce to zero the pressure in the gas pipe in respect of which such test was carried out.

section.name: s21
section.heading: General safety requirements for pressure-regulating installations

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subregulation (2), no person shall install a pressure-regulating installation in a gas supply system unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the installation is so designed that the malfunction of any part thereof, where there is no other malfunction at the same time of any other part thereof, does not cause an unsafe situation to arise in respect of the pressure of the gas supplied downstream of that installation;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: where the difference in pressure between the gas supplied to the installation and the gas supplied by the installation is such that the temperature of the gas may fall below 0° centigrade, the installation is protected against damage which may be caused by the formation of ice inside or outside the installation;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the volumetric capacity of the installation is such that it can take, at the lowest pressure at which gas will be supplied to it, and transmit, at the highest pressure at which it will supply gas, the volume of gas required for the gas supply system of which it is a part; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: where a by-pass is fitted to the installation, devices are also fitted to the installation to ensure that if there is a mal-operation of any valve fitted to that by-pass, an unsafe situation does not arise in respect of the pressure of the gas supplied downstream of that installation.

subsection.content: Subregulation (1) shall not apply to a pressure-regulating installation which will not be supplied with gas at a pressure other than low pressure.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Location of pressure-regulating installations

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subregulation (4), no person shall install a pressure-regulating installation at a location other than such that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any gas released from any relief valve used in connection with the installation will be safely dispersed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is reasonable access for the purpose of carrying out maintenance on the installation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the installation will, so far as is reasonably practicable, not be subject to flooding, subsidence or other natural hazards unless it is, so far as is reasonably practicable, protected from damage which may be caused to it thereby; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if it is located near a road, it is, so far as is reasonably practicable, protected against damage to it which may arise from a traffic accident on that road.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall install a pressure-regulating installation in a room in any premises (and irrespective of whether there is any other room in the premises) unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is sufficient space within the room to permit maintenance of the installation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is sufficient means of egress from the room to permit, so far as is reasonably practicable, the escape of personnel from the room if the installation becomes unsafe;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: each common wall of that room is gastight;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: each wall of that room is of solid construction;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the room is well-ventilated; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: explosion relief measures other than explosion relief panels are provided in the room.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall install a pressure-regulating installation in a location below the ground unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the location is not subject to flooding or, if the location is subject to flooding, the pressure-regulator breathers used in connection with the installation are extended above the level at which flooding is likely to occur such that water will not enter the diaphragm chambers of the installation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the location is in the form of a pit which is so designed and constructed that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it (and any surface covering) is able to withstand any expected surface loading without damage to the installation;

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: means are provided to permit access for maintenance and ventilation of the pit.

subsection.content: Subregulation (1) shall not apply to a pressure-regulating installation which will not be supplied with gas at a pressure other than low pressure.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Purging, etc. of gas pipes

subsection.leadIn: No person shall commission, recommission or decommission any gas pipe except by a purging procedure which ensures, so far as is reasonably practicable, that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the persons carrying out such purging, any persons working in the vicinity of the place where such purging is being carried out and members of the public are protected against any dangers which may arise from such purging;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the risk of an explosive mixture of gas and air arising in such pipe is minimized; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of the commissioning or recommissioning of such pipe, no air or inert gas remains in such pipe after such purging which may cause an unsafe situation to arise in respect of the continuity of the gas supplied downstream of such pipe.

subsection.leadIn: Where a gas pipe through which gas is supplied has the pressure of such gas reduced to zero, no person shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: carry out any work on such pipe; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: recommission such pipe,

subsection.continued: unless such pipe has been purged of such gas.

def.name: GasPipe
def.leadIn: For the purposes of this regulation, gas pipe (氣體喉管) includes any gas fitting—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: used in connection with a gas pipe; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: through which gas may flow.

section.name: s23A
section.heading: Works in the vicinity of gas pipes

subsection.content: No person shall carry out, or permit to be carried out, any works in the vicinity of a gas pipe unless he or the person carrying out the works has, before commencing the works, taken all reasonable steps to ascertain the location and position of the gas pipe.

A person who carries out, or permits to be carried out, any works in the vicinity of a gas pipe shall ensure that all reasonable measures are taken to protect the gas pipe from damage arising out of the works that would be likely to prejudice safety.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Only certain motor vehicles may carry liquefied petroleum gas

subsection.leadIn: No person shall use a motor vehicle to carry liquefied petroleum gas in bulk on a road unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the vehicle is a road tanker; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is a valid permit issued in respect of the tanker.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall use a motor vehicle to carry on a road—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any cylinder which has a water capacity of not less than 130 litres; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any combination of cylinders which have a combined water capacity of not less than 130 litres,

subsection.continued: unless—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the vehicle is a cylinder wagon; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: there is a valid permit issued in respect of the wagon.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Application for and issue of permit

subsection.leadIn: Subject to this regulation, the Authority may, upon payment of the prescribed fee, issue a permit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to the owner of a road tanker which complies with the conditions specified in Part 1 of Schedule 2 authorizing the use of the tanker to carry liquefied petroleum gas in bulk on roads; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to the owner of a cylinder wagon which complies with the conditions specified in Part 2 of Schedule 2 authorizing the use of the vehicle to carry cylinders on roads.

subsection.leadIn: An application for a permit shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: made by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the owner of the gas vehicle in respect of which the permit is sought; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a person authorized in writing by the owner in that behalf; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the approved form, and accompanied by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: such documents relating to that vehicle as are—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: specified in that form; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: required for the purpose of the Authority determining whether that vehicle complies with the relevant conditions specified in Schedule 2; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: proof, satisfactory to the Authority, of the ownership of that vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority shall refuse to issue a permit in respect of a gas vehicle if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subregulation (2) is not complied with in respect of the application for the permit;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the owner of the vehicle does not produce it for examination by an inspector in such place and at such time as the Authority specifies; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the vehicle is found on examination not to comply with the relevant conditions specified in Schedule 2.

subsection.content: Where the Authority refuses to issue a permit in respect of a gas vehicle, he shall by notice served on the owner of the vehicle inform him of that refusal and of the reasons therefor.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Form and particulars of permit
section.leadIn: A permit shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the approved form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contain the particulars specified in Schedule 3.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Permit subject to conditions

subsection.content: A permit issued in respect of a gas vehicle may be issued subject to such reasonable conditions as the Authority thinks fit and as are specified in the permit.
The Authority may at any time add to, vary or revoke any conditions specified by him under subregulation (1) in a permit and shall amend the permit accordingly.
No person shall use a gas vehicle in contravention of any condition specified in the permit issued in respect of the vehicle.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Validity of permit
section.leadIn: A permit issued in respect of a gas vehicle shall cease to be valid—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: upon the expiry of one year less one day after the date of its issue or last renewal, as the case may be, unless renewed under regulation 30;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the owner of the vehicle specified in the permit ceases to be such owner;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the vehicle is abandoned or destroyed; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the permit is cancelled under regulation 31.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Renewal of permit

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subregulation (2), the Authority may, upon—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: application to him in the approved form by the owner of a gas vehicle or a person authorized in writing by the owner in that behalf; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: payment of the prescribed fee,

subsection.continued: renew a valid permit issued in respect of the vehicle.

subsection.content: Regulation 26(2), (3) and (4) shall apply to an application to renew a permit in the like manner as it applies to an application for a permit.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Cancellation of permit

subsection.content: The Authority may, by notice served on the owner of a gas vehicle, cancel a permit issued in respect of the vehicle if the vehicle is found on examination not to comply with the relevant conditions specified in Schedule 2.
The owner of a gas vehicle who is served with a notice under subregulation (1) shall return the permit cancelled by that notice forthwith to the Authority.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Notification of change of ownership, etc.
section.leadIn: The owner of a gas vehicle in respect of which a permit has been issued shall, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he ceases to be such owner; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the vehicle is abandoned or destroyed,

section.continued: within 7 days thereafter inform the Authority of such fact, giving such details as the Authority requires, and shall at the same time return the permit to the Authority.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Permit to be produced
section.leadIn: The owner of a gas vehicle in respect of which a permit has been issued shall produce the permit for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: amendment pursuant to regulation 28(2), when so requested by the Authority; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: inspection, when so requested by the Authority, an inspector or a police officer,

section.continued: as soon as it is reasonably practicable to do so.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Issue and display of label

subsection.leadIn: The Authority shall, at the same time as he issues or renews a permit in respect of a gas vehicle, issue to the owner of the vehicle a label specifying—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the number of that permit; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date of expiry of that permit.

subsection.content: Subject to subregulation (3), no gas vehicle in respect of which a permit has been issued shall be used on a road unless the label issued with that permit is displayed on the left-hand side of the vehicle’s windscreen in such a manner that it is clearly visible from the front of the vehicle.
Where a permit issued in respect of a gas vehicle ceases to be valid under regulation 29, the label issued with that permit shall forthwith be removed from the windscreen of the vehicle.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Alterations to gas vehicle
section.leadIn: No material alteration in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the design or construction; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the relevant equipment specified in Schedule 2,

section.continued: of a gas vehicle in respect of which a permit has been issued shall be made without the permission in writing of the Authority.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Examination of gas vehicle

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may at any time require the production for examination by an inspector of any gas vehicle in respect of which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application for a permit has been made under regulation 26; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a permit has been issued,

subsection.continued: in such place and at such time as he specifies by notice in writing served on the owner of the vehicle.

subsection.content: Without prejudice to the generality of subregulation (1), an inspector or a police officer may at any time require the owner or driver of a gas vehicle in respect of which a permit has been issued to produce the vehicle for examination by an inspector in such place and at such time as the inspector or police officer, as the case may be, specifies.

The purpose of an examination referred to in subregulation (1) or (2) shall be to ascertain whether a gas vehicle complies with these regulations and any conditions of any permit issued in respect of the vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: A gas vehicle produced at any place pursuant to a requirement under this regulation may be detained for a period not exceeding—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 24 hours in the case of a requirement under subregulation (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 6 hours in the case of a requirement under subregulation (2),

subsection.continued: while the vehicle is examined.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Powers of inspector
section.leadIn: In carrying out an examination of a gas vehicle for the purposes of these regulations, an inspector may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: carry out or cause to be carried out such inspection, examination or test of the vehicle or any equipment of the vehicle as he thinks fit;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: weigh the vehicle or any load on the vehicle; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: photograph the vehicle.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Certain equipment to be carried on gas vehicle

subsection.leadIn: No person shall use a road tanker to carry liquefied petroleum gas in bulk unless there is carried on the tanker—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: not less than 2 suitable apparatus for extinguishing fire—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: of a type, and of a capacity not less than that, specified by the Authority by notice in the Gazette for the purposes of this regulation;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: each carried in such a position as to be readily accessible outside the cab of the tanker and available for use; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: maintained at all times in good and efficient working order;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not less than 2 signs each displaying a notice, in the English and Chinese languages, in letters and characters not less than 120 millimetres in height, stating the words “NO SMOKING” and the characters “不准吸煙”;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: not less than one set of protective goggles, or other suitable equipment for the protection of eyesight, and gloves for each person employed on the tanker; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: not less than 4 road cones.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall use a cylinder wagon to carry cylinders unless there is carried on the wagon not less than 2 suitable apparatus for extinguishing fire—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of a type, and of a capacity not less than that, specified by the Authority by notice in the Gazette for the purposes of this regulation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each carried in such a position as to be readily accessible outside the cab of the wagon and available for use; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: maintained at all times in good and efficient working order.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Only competent persons to be employed on gas vehicle

subsection.leadIn: No person shall carry out any operation in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the use of a road tanker which is carrying liquefied petroleum gas; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the loading into or discharge from a road tanker of liquefied petroleum gas,

subsection.continued: unless the person carrying out the operation is competent, by virtue of his training and substantial practical experience, to carry out that operation (or is under the supervision of such a person) and, without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing, such training shall include training in—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the properties of liquefied petroleum gas;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the use of the apparatus referred to in regulation 38(1)(a) carried on the tanker; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the procedures to be followed in the event of an emergency involving the tanker.

subsection.leadIn: The owner of a road tanker shall ensure that not less than 2 persons who are competent as required by subregulation (1) are employed on the tanker at all times when—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the tanker is carrying liquefied petroleum gas; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: liquefied petroleum gas is being loaded into or discharged from the tanker.

subsection.content: No person shall discharge liquefied petroleum gas from a road tanker unless, at all times during that operation, the signs referred to in regulation 38(1)(b) are prominently displayed near the tanker.

subsection.leadIn: Each person employed on a road tanker shall, at all times when liquefied petroleum gas is being loaded into or discharged from the tanker—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be not more than 50 metres from the tanker; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: have ready access to the tanker.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall carry out any operation in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the use of a cylinder wagon which is carrying cylinders; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the loading into or unloading off a cylinder wagon of cylinders,

subsection.continued: unless the person carrying out the operation is competent, by virtue of his training and substantial practical experience, to carry out that operation and, without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing, such training shall include training in—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the properties of liquefied petroleum gas;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the use of the apparatus referred to in regulation 38(2) carried on the wagon; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the procedures to be followed in the event of an emergency involving the wagon.

subsection.leadIn: The owner of a cylinder wagon shall ensure that not less than 2 persons who are competent as required by subregulation (5) are employed on the wagon at all times when either— (L.N. 462 of 1995)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the wagon is in motion and carrying cylinders on a road; or (L.N. 462 of 1995)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: cylinders are being loaded into or unloaded off the wagon.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall unload off a cylinder wagon a cylinder which has a water capacity of 50 litres or more except by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a tail-gate lift; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a method approved by the Authority by notice in the Gazette.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Safety device to be used when liquefied petroleum gas is discharged from road tanker

subsection.content: No person shall discharge liquefied petroleum gas from a road tanker into a liquefied petroleum gas receiving installation unless a safety device which complies with subregulation (2) is fitted to the tanker or the installation to protect against the dangers which may arise due to the movement of the tanker whilst the liquefied petroleum gas transfer hoses are connected between the tanker and the installation.

subsection.leadIn: The safety device referred to in subregulation (1) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be maintained at all times in good and efficient working order;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be automatic in operation; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: when in operation—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: protect the liquefied petroleum gas transfer hoses to which it is connected from rupture or other damage; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: release not more than 0.1 litres of liquefied petroleum gas in liquid form.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Special precautions against fire and explosion

subsection.leadIn: No person carrying out any operation referred to in regulation 39(1)(a) or (b) or (5)(a) or (b) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: smoke; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: carry any naked flame.

subsection.leadIn: No person shall place or carry on a gas vehicle—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), any artificial light other than a light which is not liable by virtue of its construction to ignite flammable vapour;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any artificial light which is liable to ignite flammable vapour unless it is permanently fixed to a part of the vehicle which is not likely to come into contact with flammable vapour; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any explosive substance or article capable of causing a fire or explosion, including matches and cigarette lighters.

subsection.content: No person shall place any goods in the cargo compartment of a cylinder wagon at any time when there is any cylinder in that compartment.

section.name: s42
section.heading: Inspections to be carried out by owner of gas vehicle

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, by notice in the Gazette, specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the inspections which the owner of a gas vehicle in respect of which a permit has been issued shall carry out on the vehicle or on any equipment required by these regulations to be carried on the vehicle;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the intervals at which, or the circumstances in which, such inspections shall be carried out; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the written records which shall be kept of such inspections by such owners and the periods for which any such records shall be retained by such owners.

subsection.content: The owner of a gas vehicle shall comply with the requirements of any notice under subregulation (1) applicable to him.

Where an inspection carried out on a gas vehicle, whether pursuant to a notice under subregulation (1) or otherwise, shows that it is unsafe, the owner of the vehicle shall forthwith carry out work to render it safe or, if that is not practicable, shall not use it to carry, in the case of a gas vehicle which is a road tanker, liquefied petroleum gas in bulk and, in the case of a gas vehicle which is a cylinder wagon, cylinders.

subsection.leadIn: Where an inspection carried out on any equipment referred to in subregulation (1), whether pursuant to a notice under that subregulation or otherwise, shows that it is unsafe, the owner of the gas vehicle concerned shall forthwith—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: carry out work to render the equipment safe; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: replace it with equipment which is safe.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Duplicate permit, etc.

subsection.content: Where any permit has been lost, defaced or destroyed, the Authority may, upon payment of the prescribed fee, issue to the owner of the gas vehicle in respect of which the permit was issued a duplicate permit in place thereof, and the duplicate permit so issued shall have the same effect as the original permit.
Subregulation (1) shall apply to a label in the like manner as it applies to a permit.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Other laws applicable to motor vehicles not affected
section.content: The provisions of this Part shall not affect any other law in relation to motor vehicles.

section.name: s44A
section.heading: Power to amend Schedules 2 and 3
section.content: The Secretary may, by notice in the Gazette, amend Schedule 2 or 3.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Appeals to appeal board

subsection.leadIn: Any person aggrieved by a decision of the Authority under—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: regulation 5(1)(b) or (c);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: regulation 6(2)(b)(i) in any case where regulation 6(3)(a) applies;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: regulation 6(2)(b)(ii); or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: regulation 26(3),

subsection.continued: may appeal to an appeal board against that decision.

subsection.leadIn: An appeal under this regulation shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in writing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: set out the details of or be accompanied by the notice under regulation 5(1), 6(2) or 26(4) concerned;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be commenced within 30 days after the decision appealed against was made; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: be delivered to the Secretary.

subsection.content: A person who appeals under this regulation shall deliver to the Authority notice of, and the grounds for, the appeal.
A decision referred to in subregulation (1) shall take effect immediately, notwithstanding that an appeal has been or may be made under this regulation against that decision.

section.name: s46
section.heading: Removal of liquefied petroleum gas in contravention of regulations
section.content: Where any liquefied petroleum gas is possessed, landed, shipped, transhipped, stored or otherwise dealt with, or where any vessel carrying any such gas is berthed or has anchored or stopped contrary to any requirement under the Ordinance, the Authority, or any other person acting under the orders of the Authority, may cause such gas (including any container of such gas), or such vessel to be removed, at the expense of the owner of such gas or vessel, as the case may be, to such place as may be in conformity with such requirement, and all expenses incurred in such removal may be recovered from such owner in like manner, in all respects, as a sum of money due or payable to the Government in respect of a fee is recoverable.

section.name: s47
section.heading: Valve connection of cylinder to be in contact with vapour space

subsection.content: Subject to subregulation (2), no person shall use, transport or store a cylinder which contains or has contained liquefied petroleum gas in any manner which prevents the valve connection of the cylinder from being in contact with the vapour space of the cylinder.
Subregulation (1) shall not apply to a cylinder which is used to supply liquefied petroleum gas to a fork-lift truck.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Regulation of pressure between cylinder and gas appliance

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subregulation (2), no person shall use a cylinder to supply liquefied petroleum gas to a gas appliance unless a pressure-regulator, set at the pressure at which that appliance is designed to receive gas, is fitted to the—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: valve connection of the cylinder; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: installation pipe between the cylinder and the appliance.

subsection.content: Subregulation (1) shall not apply to a cylinder and gas appliance combination which is designed to be used without a pressure-regulator.

section.name: s49
section.heading: Offences

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: Any person who contravenes regulation 23A commits an offence and is liable on conviction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a contravention of regulation 23A(1), to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a contravention of regulation 23A(2), to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 12 months and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a daily penalty of $10,000. (L.N. 455 of 1996)

subsection.content: Any person who contravenes regulation 3(1) or (2), 6B or 25(1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a daily penalty of $2,000. (22 of 1996 s. 7)

subsection.name: 1AA
subsection.content: The owner of a notifiable gas installation who contravenes regulation 6C(2)(a) or (b) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2. (22 of 1996 s. 7)

subsection.leadIn: Any person who contravenes any condition to which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a construction approval is subject under regulation 5(1)(b) or (4); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an approval is subject under regulation 6(2)(b)(i),

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a daily penalty of $1,000.

subsection.content: The owner of a container who contravenes regulation 7(1) or (3), the owner of a cylinder who contravenes regulation 8(2), the owner of a tank who contravenes regulation 8(3), (4) or (6), 10(1) or 12(1), the owner of a liquefied petroleum gas storage installation who contravenes regulation 11 and the owner of a vaporiser who contravenes regulation 14(1) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a daily penalty of $1,000. (22 of 1996 s. 7)

Any person who contravenes regulation 8(1), 10(2), 17(1), (2), (3), (4), (5), (6)(a) or (c), (7), (8), (9) or (10), 18(1), (2) or (3), 19, 20(1), (2) or (3), 28(3), 39(1), (3), (4), (5) or (7) or 41(2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

The owner of a tank who contravenes regulation 8(5) or 12(2), the owner of a cylinder who contravenes regulation 9 and the owner of a vaporiser who contravenes regulation 14(2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a daily penalty of $500.
Any person who contravenes regulation 13 or 41(3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.
Any person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes regulation 16, 17(6)(b), 23(1) or (2) or 38(1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.
Any person who contravenes regulation 21(1), 22(1), (2) or (3), 40(1) or 41(1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

The owner of a gas vehicle who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes regulation 31(2), 32 or 33 commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a daily penalty of $100.

Where regulation 34(2) or (3) is contravened in respect of a gas vehicle, the owner of the vehicle commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a daily penalty of $100.
Where regulation 35 is contravened in respect of a gas vehicle, the owner of the vehicle commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

The owner of a gas vehicle who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes regulation 36(1) (where paragraph (b) of that regulation applies) or (2), or the driver of a gas vehicle who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes regulation 36(2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

The owner of a road tanker who contravenes regulation 39(2) and the owner of a gas vehicle (except a cylinder wagon) who contravenes regulation 42(3) or (4) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

The owner of a cylinder wagon who contravenes regulation 39(6), the owner of a gas vehicle who contravenes regulation 42(2) and the owner of a gas vehicle (except a road tanker) who contravenes regulation 42(3) or (4) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.
Any person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes regulation 47(1) or 48(1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

section.name: s49A
section.heading: Defences

subsection.content: Where a code or codes of practice are in effect in relation to the requirements of regulation 23A(1) or (2), it shall be a defence to a charge under regulation 49 alleging a contravention of that subregulation for the person charged to show that he has complied with the provisions of that code or those codes as regards such requirements.

subsection.leadIn: It shall be a defence to a charge under regulation 49 alleging a contravention of regulation 23A(2) in relation to works carried out in the vicinity of a gas pipe for the person charged to show that he did not know the location and position of the gas pipe and that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: before the works were commenced, he had taken all reasonable steps to ascertain the location and position of any gas pipe in the area of the works; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he could not reasonably have been expected, having regard to the steps so taken, to have known the location and position of the gas pipe,

subsection.continued: and for the purposes of paragraph (a), where a code or codes of practice are in effect in relation to the requirements of regulation 23A(1), a person who shows that he has complied with the provisions of that code or those codes as regards such requirements shall be deemed to have shown that he has taken all reasonable steps to ascertain the location and position of any gas pipe in the area of the works.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Exemptions

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may exempt in writing any person from any of the provisions of these regulations specified in such exemption—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the Authority is of the opinion that the safety of members of the public will not be prejudiced by such exemption; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to such reasonable conditions as the Authority thinks fit specified in such exemption.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may by notice in the Gazette exempt any class of persons from any of the provisions of these regulations specified in such exemption—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the Authority is of the opinion that the safety of members of the public will not be prejudiced by such exemption; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to such reasonable conditions as the Authority thinks fit specified in such exemption.
